The filing means the Justice Department is taking a different view than another part of the government, the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission.

The Justice Department filed its brief in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals, arguing the language in civil rights law does not bar discrimination against gay or lesbian workers.
David Lopez, former general counsel of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, says he was taken aback.

Greg Nevins is an attorney for Lambda Legal and has argued many discrimination cases on behalf of gay and lesbian workers.
